--- title: A map of current machine learning frameworks frontlogo: /img/sfudrac.png author: Marie-Hélène Burle date: 2023-10-03 date-format: long execute: error: true echo: true format: revealjs: # embed-resources: true theme: [default, ../revealjs.scss] logo: /img/sfudrac_logo.png highlight-style: monokai code-line-numbers: false template-partials: - ../title-slide.html pointer: color: "#b5111b" pointerSize: 32 link-external-newwindow: true footer:  Back to the course auto-stretch: false revealjs-plugins: - pointer --- ```{dot} //| echo: false strict graph { bgcolor="transparent" graph [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] node [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif", shape=plaintext] "Traditional machine learning\n(ML)\n→ computational statistics\n→ predictive analytics" [URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computational_statistics", fontsize=8, fontcolor=darkolivegreen] "Deep learning\n(DL)\n→ artificial neural networks" [URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_learning", fontsize=8, fontcolor=darkcyan] Type -- {"Traditional machine learning\n(ML)\n→ computational statistics\n→ predictive analytics" "Deep learning\n(DL)\n→ artificial neural networks"} } ``` --- ```{dot} //| echo: false strict graph { bgcolor="transparent" graph [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] node [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif", shape=plaintext] Python [fontcolor=darkgoldenrod, URL="https://www.python.org/"] Julia [fontcolor=darkorchid2, URL="https://julialang.org/"] R [fontcolor=cornflowerblue, URL="https://www.r-project.org/"] Language -- {Python Julia R} } ``` --- ```{dot} //| echo: false strict graph { bgcolor="transparent" graph [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] node [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] label="Most classic frameworks\n\n" labelloc=t fontsize=27 subgraph cluster_ml { peripheries=0 label="Traditional machine learning\n\n" fontcolor=darkolivegreen fontsize=20 "scikit-learn" "Several Julia ML packages" "Many R ML packages" } subgraph cluster_dl { peripheries=0 label="\nDeep learning" fontcolor=darkcyan fontsize=20 labelloc=b Torch TensorFlow Jax Keras "Several Julia DL packages" "Several R DL packages" } Python [color=darkgoldenrod, fontcolor=darkgoldenrod, URL="https://www.python.org/"] Julia [color=darkorchid2, fontcolor=darkorchid2, URL="https://julialang.org/"] R [color=cornflowerblue, fontcolor=cornflowerblue, URL="https://www.r-project.org/"] "scikit-learn" -- Python [color=darkgoldenrod] Python -- {Torch TensorFlow Jax Keras} [color=darkgoldenrod] {"Several Julia ML packages" "scikit-learn"} -- Julia [color=darkorchid2] Julia -- {"Several Julia DL packages" Torch TensorFlow Keras} [color=darkorchid2] {"scikit-learn" "Many R ML packages"} -- R [color=cornflowerblue] R -- {"Several R DL packages" Torch TensorFlow Keras} [color=cornflowerblue] "Several Julia ML packages" [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] "Several Julia DL packages" [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] "Many R ML packages" [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] "Several R DL packages" [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] Jax [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55, URL="https://jax.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html"] "scikit-learn" [URL="https://scikit-learn.org/stable/"] Keras [URL="https://keras.io/"] TensorFlow [URL="https://www.tensorflow.org/"] Torch [URL="https://pytorch.org/"] } ``` A fast evolving field: \  - [MXNET](https://github.com/apache/mxnet) was *just* retired a few days ago \  - [caffe2](https://github.com/facebookarchive/caffe2) is now part of [PyTorch](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/) \  - [keras](https://github.com/keras-team/keras-core) has been the high-level frontend for a shifting list of backends \   (currently [TensorFlow](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow), [PyTorch](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch?fbclid=IwAR3mdJ6akutefkkOuCbzhsSRqrJPumMkpGIZvCxz-xRWcdYU2uw63yn2_ig), [jax](https://github.com/google/jax)) --- ```{dot} //| echo: false strict graph { label="Python\n\n" labelloc=t fontsize=30 bgcolor="transparent" graph [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] node [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] subgraph cluster_ml { peripheries=0 label="Traditional machine learning\n\n" fontcolor=darkolivegreen fontsize=20 "scikit-learn" "Several Julia ML packages" "Many R ML packages" } subgraph cluster_dl { peripheries=0 label="\nDeep learning" fontcolor=darkcyan fontsize=20 labelloc=b Torch TensorFlow Jax Keras "Several Julia DL packages" "Several R DL packages" } packages" [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] Jax [color=gray55, fontcolor=gray55] } ``` --- ```{dot} //| echo: false strict graph { bgcolor="transparent" graph [fontname="Inconsolata, sans-serif"] node [style=invis] node [fontsize=18] {rank=same; e1071 kernlab rpart party caret gmodels randomForest ranger} {rank=same; ipred gbm xgboost C50 cluster class mclust naivebayes glmnet} e1071 -- ipred } subgraph cluster_dl { label="\nDeep learning" color=cornflowerblue fontcolor=darkcyan fontsize=20 labelloc=b node [fontsize=18] RSNNS h2o darch deepr RCNN4R rcppDL rnn neuralnet deepnet } ranger [URL=""] randomForest [URL=""] gmodels [URL="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/gmodels/index.html"] caret [URL=""] party [URL="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/party/index.html"] rpart [URL=""] kernlab [URL=""] e1071 [URL=""] glmnet [URL=""] naivebayes [URL=""] mclust [URL=""] class [URL=""] cluster [URL=""] C50 [URL=""] xgboost [URL=""] gbm [URL=""] ipred [URL=""] deepnet [URL=""] neuralnet [URL=""] rnn [URL=""] rcppDL [URL=""] RCNN4R [URL=""] deepr [URL=""] darch [URL=""] h2o [URL=""] RSNNS [URL=""] R [fontcolor=cornflowerblue, URL="https://www.r-project.org/"] cluster -- R [ltail=cluster_ml, color=cornflowerblue] R -- RCNN4R [lhead=cluster_dl, color=cornflowerblue] } ``` The [Machine Learning CRAN Task View](https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/MachineLearning.html) is a good resource ## Language strengths
```{org} | | Python | Julia | R | |----------------+-----------------+------------------------+-----------------------| | | | | | | **Strengths** | Large user base | Fast | Countless ML packages | | | Good frameworks | Lots of new approaches | | | | | | | | | | | | | **Weaknesses** | Slow | Small user base | Too slow for DL | ``` --- Language strengths: Julia: fastest language by far, several very strong packages not available in other languages, all common packages ported through wrappers. Great for ML and DL Python: used by most people, most common packages developed for it. Great for DL, more limited options in ML R: largest library by far for stats and modelling, meaning incredible amount of options for ML. Slowest language, limited options for DL. Great for ML, limited for DL data: http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ slide on automatic differentiation: in Python: https://github.com/HIPS https://juliahub.com/ui/Search?t=machine-learning https://juliapackages.com/c/machine-learning?order=asc&sort=created&page=4 https://sciml.ai/ https://forem.julialang.org/jacobusmmsmit/thoughts-on-using-jax-and-julia-2f0b https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54527439/differences-in-scikit-learn-keras-or-pytorch https://pytorch-geometric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ https://juliapackages.com/c/machine-learning https://graphviz.org/docs/attrs/href/
